intro: Psychotria kolly, commonly known as the Kolly Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in montane forests. Psychotria kolly is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical uses, though further research is needed to fully understand its properties.
